turns.speaker: IMMIGRATION OFFICER
turns.text: Next.  Could I see your documents, please?

turns.speaker: EMIL
turns.text: Yes sir.

turns.speaker: IMMIGRATION OFFICER
turns.text: What is your intended purpose of your visit to the United States?

turns.speaker: EMIL
turns.text: Two weeks holiday.

turns.speaker: IMMIGRATION OFFICER
turns.text: How much money are you carrying with you?

turns.speaker: EMIL
turns.text: I have five-hundred dollars.

turns.speaker: IMMIGRATION OFFICER
turns.text: Can you show me?  Sir, no cameras in the FIS area!

turns.speaker: IMMIGRATION OFFICER
turns.text: Is he with you?  Are you travelling together?

turns.speaker: EMIL
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: IMMIGRATION OFFICER
turns.text: Please join us.  Come on forward.

turns.speaker: EMIL
turns.text: Is there a problem?

turns.speaker: IMMIGRATION OFFICER
turns.text: No, you're travelling together.  I want to talk to you together.  Hi, how are you?  Can I take a look at your documents?  Are you related?

turns.speaker: EMIL
turns.text: We are both from Prague.

turns.speaker: IMMIGRATION OFFICER
turns.text: How long are you planning to stay?

turns.speaker: EMIL
turns.text: Two weeks.

turns.speaker: IMMIGRATION OFFICER
turns.text: I'd like to speak for himself, okay?

turns.speaker: EMIL
turns.text: He doesn't speak English.

turns.speaker: EMIL
turns.text: Who is he?

turns.speaker: VENDOR
turns.text: New York's finest.  This is his case.

turns.speaker: VENDOR
turns.text: This all you want?

turns.speaker: EMIL
turns.text: Do you know how much killer gets for movie rights?

turns.speaker: VENDOR
turns.text: In here, says he wants a million.

turns.speaker: EMIL
turns.text: Million?!  The killer gets one million dollars for a television interview?

turns.speaker: VENDOR
turns.text: Hey, tabloids paid Ted Bundy - famous serial killer - half a million for his interview.  And how much you think Monica got for writing book about the President coming on to her?  It pays to be a killer or a whore in this country. Look, you want magazine or not?

turns.speaker: EMIL
turns.text: Yes.  Both.

turns.speaker: EMIL
turns.text: Just do what I do.  Say the same thing I say.  Don't open your mouth.

turns.speaker: OLEG
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: EMIL
turns.text: Don't fool around.

turns.speaker: OLEG
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: EMIL
turns.text: Did you hear what I said?

turns.speaker: OLEG
turns.text: I want to document my trip to America.

turns.speaker: OLEG
turns.text: Look.  Times Square.  Just like in the movies!

turns.speaker: EMIL
turns.text: Don't speak Russian!

turns.speaker: OLEG
turns.text: Why?  Why do I always have to speak to you in Czech?

turns.speaker: EMIL
turns.text: Because I don't like your ugly language. I heard enough of it in school!  Now speak Czech or English.  And don't fool around anymore.  You almost got us thrown out!

turns.speaker: OLEG
turns.text: Look.  New videocameras.  Color viewfinder.  Image stabilization. Solarization.  Night vision.

turns.speaker: EMIL
turns.text: We have no money.  Come on.

turns.speaker: EMIL
turns.text: Turn that off!  Get the bags.

turns.speaker: OLEG
turns.text: Why should I carry your bag?  I am not a dog.

turns.speaker: EMIL
turns.text: For five years I paid for your stupidness - you'll carry my bag for the rest of my life if I say so.  Unless you refuse, Oleg.

turns.speaker: OLEG
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: EMIL
turns.text: Smell like chemicals...for smoking drugs.

turns.speaker: EMIL
turns.text: Turn that fucking thing off!

turns.speaker: OLEG
turns.text: I'm not filming.  I'm watching Milos die.  It's just like a move but realer.

turns.speaker: EMIL
turns.text: Speak English!

turns.speaker: OLEG
turns.text: You said speak Czech!

turns.speaker: EMIL
turns.text: How you erase this?

turns.speaker: OLEG
turns.text: I'll do it.  Don't hurt my camera!

turns.speaker: OLEG
turns.text: Whore?

turns.speaker: EMIL
turns.text: I'm homesick.  You have Eastern European girl?  A Czech girl?

turns.speaker: EMIL
turns.text: Get in the bathroom!

turns.speaker: OLEG
turns.text: Whatever we do - we fuck her, right?

turns.speaker: EMIL
turns.text: Oleg, get in bathroom, stay there and shut up!

turns.speaker: OLEG
turns.text: Gotta light the scene better.  Now it's more moody... like a scene from THE THIRD MAN.

turns.speaker: EMIL
turns.text: Shut up.

turns.speaker: OLEG
turns.text: Does it hurt?

turns.speaker: OLEG
turns.text: Oh, shit.  I hate looking at that!

turns.speaker: EMIL
turns.text: Don't want to film this?

turns.speaker: OLEG
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: EMIL
turns.text: The video of Milos and Tamina - I told you to erase it.

turns.speaker: OLEG
turns.text: I did.

turns.speaker: EMIL
turns.text: And the whore's murder?  You didn't erase that either, did you?  Don't lie, I won't be angry.

turns.speaker: OLEG
turns.text: Why not?

turns.speaker: EMIL
turns.text: Put the camera down, Oleg.

turns.speaker: OLEG
turns.text: What is that?

turns.speaker: EMIL
turns.text: What does it look like?  It's an address book!

turns.speaker: OLEG
turns.text: Let me get a shot of it.

turns.speaker: EMIL
turns.text: Sit down!

turns.speaker: OLEG
turns.text: This way.  Hold it this way.  Good.

turns.speaker: EMIL
turns.text: No.  We are insane.  Who else but crazy men would film their murders?  So we kill someone famous and if we are caught, we are sent to mental hospital. But what good is money there?  Because once in hospital I say I not crazy. Just pretended to be acquitted.  We see psychiatrists.  They must certify we are sane and because of your - what is law called?  Oh - I got it.  Because of your Double Jeopardy law, we can't be tried for same crime twice.  We come out free, rich and famous!

turns.speaker: OLEG
turns.text: Good idea!

turns.speaker: EMIL
turns.text: Okay.  He has nothing to say.  Start the camera!

turns.speaker: OLEG
turns.text: Cut!

turns.speaker: OLEG
turns.text: You are success story?  I am success story!  Why do you say I and not we?

turns.speaker: EMIL
turns.text: Oleg, don't be paranoid.  You got a hundred-fifty thousand dollars, didn't you?  I gave you half of what they gave me.  Look - here we are!

turns.speaker: OLEG
turns.text: In movie they make of us, who do you think would act me?

turns.speaker: EMIL
turns.text: The one who got caught in the bathroom.  George Michael.

turns.speaker: OLEG
turns.text: I'm serious.

turns.speaker: EMIL
turns.text: Shut up.  Look!

turns.speaker: OLEG
turns.text: This is my project.  I say 'action.'  I am the director!  You are the talent. You wait for me to say 'action.'  And 'action!'

turns.speaker: EMIL
turns.text: Bad last moment - I cut it out.

turns.speaker: EMIL
turns.text: I told you to cut that out before we handed in the tape!

turns.speaker: OLEG
turns.text: Be quiet.  Watch.

turns.speaker: EMIL
turns.text: Why did you leave that stuff in about you being the director?

turns.speaker: OLEG
turns.text: Because I am the director.  Don't you realize, if it wasn't for my film, for my talent, my idea to do this - no way would we be sitting here right now.

turns.speaker: EMIL
turns.text: Your idea?  I thought it was my idea.

turns.speaker: OLEG
turns.text: I'm serious...this - this is a great American film.  Full of violence and sex.  And I want my credit.

turns.speaker: EMIL
turns.text: Credit?

turns.speaker: OLEG
turns.text: Yes.  Before we hand in the next video - I put titles on it and my credit is going to read - Directed by Oleg Razgul.

turns.speaker: EMIL
turns.text: Yes.  But there's only one problem - you want credit but the problem is - I don't share credit.

turns.speaker: EMIL
turns.text: You got that?

turns.speaker: OLEG
turns.text: No, I don't get that!

turns.speaker: EMIL
turns.text: You think you are a director?  You are a fucking little, small Russian piece of shit.  And I hate you.  I fucking hate you.

turns.speaker: EMIL
turns.text: Traitor!!

turns.speaker: OLEG
turns.text: No.  You are the traitor.  You are murderer.  I am director.  Action!

turns.speaker: MILOS
turns.text: Emil???!

turns.speaker: EMIL
turns.text: Surprise!  Surprise!

turns.speaker: EMIL
turns.text: Your sister said she didn't know where you were so you shouldn't write to her with return address if you're hiding.

turns.speaker: MILOS
turns.text: Did you hurt her?

turns.speaker: EMIL
turns.text: You know me...I never hurt anybody. Where's the money?

turns.speaker: MILOS
turns.text: Take your eyes off her, Oleg!  Look.  It wasn't my fault you two were caught.  It's his fault.  Trying to get the bank clerk's phone number?!  I wasn't going to wait!!!

turns.speaker: EMIL
turns.text: Milos.  Get my money!

turns.speaker: MILOS
turns.text: We spent it!

turns.speaker: EMIL
turns.text: Ha. Ha.

turns.speaker: MILOS
turns.text: Look at the way we live.  I'm a plumber. You think I'd be working if I had money?!

turns.speaker: MILOS
turns.text: I can get you a job.

turns.speaker: EMIL
turns.text: A job?

turns.speaker: MILOS
turns.text: Yes, the money is good.

turns.speaker: EMIL
turns.text: As a plumber?!

turns.speaker: MILOS
turns.text: It's easy to learn.

turns.speaker: EMIL
turns.text: A job??  As a plumber???  You think I come to America to work!

turns.speaker: MILOS
turns.text: We started over, you can too.

turns.speaker: EMIL
turns.text: You spent all the money while I was in prison?  Now you tell me to get a job fixing toilets?!?

turns.speaker: MAGGIE
turns.text: Robert...?

turns.speaker: HAWKINS
turns.text: What are you doing here?

turns.speaker: MAGGIE
turns.text: You've got a call.

turns.speaker: HAWKINS
turns.text: I can't talk to anybody right now, can't you see I'm busy!  I can't talk business.  Hang up.  Have a drink.  Get her a whiskey.

turns.speaker: MAGGIE
turns.text: Trust me, you'll want to take this call.

turns.speaker: HAWKINS
turns.text: Viewer discretion advised!

turns.speaker: MAGGIE
turns.text: You want the tape?  There it is!

turns.speaker: HAWKINS
turns.text: Isn't he a little moody?

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: Of course he's moody.  He thinks he's in love.

turns.speaker: HAWKINS
turns.text: In love?  With who?

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: HAWKINS
turns.text: Paulie, you've got kids, right?

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: And you, you'll pay for what you did!

turns.speaker: HAWKINS
turns.text: This footage will work in your favor. When the jury sees this - no matter what Cutler tries, they'll convict him.

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: You outta be ashamed.  Ashamed of yourself.

turns.speaker: HAWKINS
turns.text: If I didn't put it on somebody else would!  I was his friend!

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: Don't give me that fucking shit.

turns.speaker: HAWKINS
turns.text: I know.

turns.speaker: NICOLETTE
turns.text: What do you mean you know?  He told you he was gonna propose to me?

turns.speaker: HAWKINS
turns.text: Well, he...

turns.speaker: NICOLETTE
turns.text: I want to hear everything he said.

turns.speaker: HAWKINS
turns.text: I'm trying to tell you.

turns.speaker: NICOLETTE
turns.text: Alright.  Go ahead.

turns.speaker: HAWKINS
turns.text: That morning.  He was talking to me and Leon about marriage.

turns.speaker: NICOLETTE
turns.text: Oh my G-d.  We were having lunch here. He started making overtures - talking about little shoes next to his in his closet but I got a call to anchor - and I walked out on him.  I walked out on him when he was trying to ask me to marry him!!

turns.speaker: OLEG
turns.text: Yes...he's my friend.

turns.speaker: IMMIGRATION OFFICER
turns.text: Okay.  You're a Czech national and you're a Russian national.  How do you know one another?

turns.speaker: OLEG
turns.text: I speak English.

turns.speaker: IMMIGRATION OFFICER
turns.text: Then answer my questions.  Where were you planning to stay during the two weeks that you're here?

turns.speaker: OLEG
turns.text: New York.

turns.speaker: IMMIGRATION OFFICER
turns.text: Yes, we're in New York now.  But where are you planning to stay in New York?

turns.speaker: OLEG
turns.text: A cheap hotel.

turns.speaker: IMMIGRATION OFFICER
turns.text: What are you coming here to do?

turns.speaker: OLEG
turns.text: I'm here for movies.

turns.speaker: IMMIGRATION OFFICER
turns.text: Movies...to be in the movies or to see movies?

turns.speaker: OLEG
turns.text: Yes.  No.  Both.  When I was a boy, I see movie at school called "It's a Wonderful Life" directed by Frank Capra. Ever since I want to come to America. Land of the free.  Home of the brave.  A land where anyone can be anything. As long as they are white.

turns.speaker: IMMIGRATION OFFICER
turns.text: Excuse me?

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: No.  Go ahead.

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: Thanks.  Appreciate it.

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: So the way you see it, two crack heads burned themselves up?

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: That's what it looks like to me.

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: And while they're burning up, they're still goin' down on each other?  You got to hand it to them.

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: Yeah, well, some people got their priorities straight.

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: What was that?

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: Evidence.  Of a homicide.

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: I'll take him.

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: No way!  He's mine!

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: We're takin' him.  Don't argue!

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: He's my collar!

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: Well, he killed my partner!

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: He's yours but I take him in!  I'll drive him to the precinct, you can have him but I'm walkin' him in.

turns.speaker: MUGGER
turns.text: Got any spare change?  How 'bout a spare twenty?

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: Look, I don't have time for you, get out of my way!!

turns.speaker: MUGGER
turns.text: Alright, how 'bout all your fuckin' money?

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: Okay, you're under arrest!  Now you happy?

turns.speaker: MUGGER
turns.text: Fire Department?  Firemen don't carry guns.

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: Oh yeah?  Guess again.

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: I'll send a cop back for you.

turns.speaker: MUGGER
turns.text: Hey.  C'mon, you can't leave me like this.  Some freak'll come by and stab me!

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: You okay?

turns.speaker: MUGGER
turns.text: A dog pissed on me!!  I'm gonna sue you for this!  You violated my civil rights!

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: Your civil rights?!  You tried to rob me!  I could arrest you right now! You're lucky you're walking away from this.  Now get outta here.

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: What's that on your forehead, Max? That's a nice attention getter.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Yeah, I'm religious.  I'm not an Atheist like you!  Now, are you guys gonna arrest me, or not?

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: How did you start the fire this time?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I used an accelerant.

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: Yeah?  What kind?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Hey, by the way, I'm really sorry about your wife leavin' you.

turns.speaker: KORFIN
turns.text: Where you been, man?  We got a celebrity!

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: I heard.  Who the hell let them up there?

turns.speaker: KORFIN
turns.text: I don't know, you think Eddie will give me his autograph?

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: You see anything in the crowd?  Anybody suspicious?

turns.speaker: KORFIN
turns.text: Naw - I'm sure the suspect's not here.

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: Oh yeah, why?

turns.speaker: KORFIN
turns.text: 'Cause Eddie woulda locked him up by now!

turns.speaker: KORFIN
turns.text: Nah, not at all.  Detective Flemming - Bobby Korfin.  My Uncle Tony worked with you at 2-1 back when you were a rookie.

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: Could you put out the cigar?  Part of the job is picking up scents.

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: Mouth's clean, too.

turns.speaker: KORFIN
turns.text: Clean?

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: Don't blow your nose!

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: The smoke'll permeate your nostrils - burn 'em out.  Let it run.

turns.speaker: KORFIN
turns.text: But you knew that, right?

turns.speaker: KORFIN
turns.text: You see Eddie's face when I gave him the timer?  Wish I had a picture of it.

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: He knew all along.

turns.speaker: KORFIN
turns.text: What??

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: That's why he was so quiet.  He was testing us.

turns.speaker: KORFIN
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: There was a woman - I think she wanted to talk to us.  She looked scared.  Oh shit!  Oh no!

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: Now that you know him, maybe you can get extra work in the next movie they make about him.

turns.speaker: KORFIN
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: Maybe you can be his stand-in.

turns.speaker: KORFIN
turns.text: -- From Czechoslovakia?  And how long have they been livin' in your building?  Alright, I'll be in touch when we know somethin'.  Milos and Tamina Karlova.  They were quiet and kept to themselves.  Landlord don't know who your girl is.

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: How long they been livin' here?

turns.speaker: KORFIN
turns.text: You hear that question, Garcia?

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: You go home.  I'm takin' your car and goin' back to the crime scene.

turns.speaker: KORFIN
turns.text: Aren't you tired?

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: If I go home I won't be able to fall asleep anyway.

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: Bobby, Bobby!  Where're you hit?!

turns.speaker: KORFIN
turns.text: It hurts.  Aw, Jesus!

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: Lay down.  Stay down, Bobby.

turns.speaker: KORFIN
turns.text: How was it?

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: Not good.

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: Get outta here!

turns.speaker: KORFIN
turns.text: What the hell happened?

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: They were inside.  They booby trapped her apartment!

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: Room was registered to a Francis Capra.

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: Capra?  That's not Czech or Russian. Who said he sounded Russian?

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: The clerk?

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: What are you gonna do?

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: Don't you get it?  He knew he was gonna get caught!  That's why he videotaped Eddie's murder - he thinks he's gonna get off.

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: Don't stoop to his level!

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: Take the car.  Get outta here, Tommy.

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: Look, you can't shoot him in cold blood.

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: GET OUTTA HERE NOW!!  GET IN THAT CAR AND DRIVE AWAY!!!  DO WHAT I SAY OR I'LL KILL YOU, TOO!!!

turns.speaker: STEPHEN GELLER
turns.text: This had nothing to do with shoes that didn't fit or my relationship with my father who, as you know, made a fortune selling penny loafers in the fifties. These people died because of the criminal actions of my doctor.

turns.speaker: ROBERT HAWKINS
turns.text: Your doctor?

turns.speaker: STEPHEN GELLER
turns.text: Yes.  My psychiatrist didn't insist that I stay on my medication.

turns.speaker: ROBERT HAWKINS
turns.text: ...so you feel absolutely no responsibility for killing these people?

turns.speaker: STEPHEN GELLER
turns.text: It was my finger that pulled the trigger, but I'm not morally responsible.  My psychiatrist knew what I was capable of.  How could I know. I'm not a doctor.

turns.speaker: ROBERT HAWKINS
turns.text: You seem very savvy for a man who's been found mentally incompetent to stand trial.

turns.speaker: STEPHEN GELLER
turns.text: Look, I'm a victim here, too.  I was a year away from getting my masters in Art, now I'll never graduate.  My life has been permanently disrupted.

turns.speaker: ROBERT HAWKINS
turns.text: Permanently disrupted?  Aren't you selling paintings now for quite a lot of money?  Hasn't this 'incident' as you call it, jump started your career as an artist?

turns.speaker: STEPHEN GELLER
turns.text: Look, I'm in here.  You call this a career move?

turns.speaker: ROBERT HAWKINS
turns.text: And isn't there a movie in the works about you?

turns.speaker: STEPHEN GELLER
turns.text: We're in negotiations, that's correct.

turns.speaker: ROBERT HAWKINS
turns.text: But doesn't the Son of Sam Law prevent criminals from profiting from their crimes?

turns.speaker: STEPHEN GELLER
turns.text: That doesn't apply to me because I'm not a criminal.  I'm not a criminal!  I wasn't convicted.

turns.speaker: B20
turns.text: SPACE STATTION 5 - LOUNGE

turns.speaker: FLOYD
turns.text: Well, how nice to see you again, Elena. You're looking wonderful.

turns.speaker: B20
turns.text: CONTINUED

turns.speaker: FLOYD
turns.text: I'm afraid I've only got a few minutes, but I'd love to.

turns.speaker: B20
turns.text: CONTINUED

turns.speaker: FLOYD
turns.text: She's wonderful.

turns.speaker: B20
turns.text: CONTINUED

turns.speaker: FLOYD
turns.text: Well, I suppose they've been having a bit of trouble with some of the equipment.

turns.speaker: B20
turns.text: CONTINUED

turns.speaker: FLOYD
turns.text: How did they manage to do that without any communication?

turns.speaker: B20
turns.text: CONTINUED

turns.speaker: FLOYD
turns.text: I'm sorry, Dr. Smyslov, but I'm really not at liberty to discuss this.

turns.speaker: B20
turns.text: CONTINUED

turns.speaker: FLOYD
turns.text: We're trying to get there. I hope we can.

turns.speaker: BOWMAN
turns.text: Hi. Frank... coming in, please.

turns.speaker: POOLE
turns.text: Right. Just a sec.

turns.speaker: BOWMAN
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: POOLE
turns.text: Okay, come on down.

turns.speaker: POOLE
turns.text: Dave, if you've a minute, I'd like your advice on something.

turns.speaker: BOWMAN
turns.text: Sure, what is it?

turns.speaker: POOLE
turns.text: Well, it's nothing really important, but it's annoying.

turns.speaker: BOWMAN
turns.text: What's up?

turns.speaker: POOLE
turns.text: It's about my salary cheques.

turns.speaker: BOWMAN
turns.text: Yes?

turns.speaker: POOLE
turns.text: Well I got the papers on my official up-grading to AGS-19 two weeks before we left.

turns.speaker: POOLE
turns.text: That's right. Well, naturally, I didn't say anything to Payroll. I assumed they'd start paying me at the higher grade on the next pay cheque. But it's been almost three weeks now and I'm still being paid as an AGS-18.

turns.speaker: BOWMAN
turns.text: Interesting that you mention it, because I've got the same problem.

turns.speaker: POOLE
turns.text: Really.

turns.speaker: BOWMAN
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: POOLE
turns.text: Yesterday, I finally called the Accounting Office at Mission Control, and all they could tell me was that they'd received the AGS-19 notification for the other three but not mine, and apparently not yours either.

turns.speaker: POOLE
turns.text: Not really. They just said it might be because we trained at Houston and they trained in Marshall, and that we're being charged against differ- ent accounting offices.

turns.speaker: BOWMAN
turns.text: It's possible.

turns.speaker: POOLE
turns.text: Well, what do you think we ought to do about it?

turns.speaker: BOWMAN
turns.text: I don't think we should make any fuss about it yet. I'm sure they'll straighten it out.

turns.speaker: POOLE
turns.text: I must say, I never did understand why they split us into two groups for training.

turns.speaker: BOWMAN
turns.text: No. I never did, either.

turns.speaker: BOWMAN
turns.text: I suppose the idea was specialized training.

turns.speaker: POOLE
turns.text: I suppose so. Though, of course, there's a more sinister explanation.

turns.speaker: BOWMAN
turns.text: Oh?

turns.speaker: POOLE
turns.text: Yes. You must have heard the rumour that went around during orbital check-out.

turns.speaker: BOWMAN
turns.text: No, as a matter of fact, I didn't.

turns.speaker: POOLE
turns.text: Oh, well, apparently there's something about the mission that the sleeping beauties know that we don't know, and that's why we were trained separately and that's why they were put to sleep before they were even taken aboard.

turns.speaker: POOLE
turns.text: I don't know. All I heard is that there's something about the mission we weren't told.

turns.speaker: BOWMAN
turns.text: That seems very unlikely.

turns.speaker: POOLE
turns.text: Yes, I thought so.

turns.speaker: BOWMAN
turns.text: Of course, it would be very easy for us to find out now.

turns.speaker: POOLE
turns.text: How?

turns.speaker: BOWMAN
turns.text: Just ask Hal. It's conceivable they might keep something from us, but they'd never keep anything from Hal.

turns.speaker: POOLE
turns.text: That's true.

turns.speaker: POOLE
turns.text: Not really. Though, it is strange when you think about it. It didn't really make any sense to keep us apart during training.

turns.speaker: BOWMAN
turns.text: Yes, but it's to fantastic to think that they'd keep something from us.

turns.speaker: POOLE
turns.text: I know. It would be almost inconceivable.

turns.speaker: BOWMAN
turns.text: But not completely inconceivable?

turns.speaker: POOLE
turns.text: I suppose it isn't logically impossible.

turns.speaker: BOWMAN
turns.text: I guess it isn't.

turns.speaker: POOLE
turns.text: Still, all we have to do is ask Hal.

turns.speaker: BOWMAN
turns.text: Well, that's something.

turns.speaker: POOLE
turns.text: Yes, I don't know what to make of it.

turns.speaker: BOWMAN
turns.text: I suppose computers have been known to be wrong.

turns.speaker: POOLE
turns.text: Yes, but it's more likely that the tolerances on our testing gear are too low.

turns.speaker: BOWMAN
turns.text: Anyway, it's just as well that we replace it. Better safe than sorry.

turns.speaker: BOWMAN
turns.text: Good morning. How's it going?

turns.speaker: POOLE
turns.text: Are you reasonably awake?

turns.speaker: BOWMAN
turns.text: Oh, I'm fine, I'm wide awake. What's up?

turns.speaker: POOLE
turns.text: Well... Hal's reported the AO-unit about to fail again.

turns.speaker: BOWMAN
turns.text: You're kidding.

turns.speaker: POOLE
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: POOLE
turns.text: I don't know. Hal said he thought it might be the assembly procedure.

turns.speaker: BOWMAN
turns.text: Two units in four days. How many spares do we have?

turns.speaker: POOLE
turns.text: Two more.

turns.speaker: BOWMAN
turns.text: Well, I hope there's nothing wrong with the assembly on those. Other- wise we're out of business.

turns.speaker: POOLE
turns.text: Hal?

turns.speaker: BOWMAN
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: POOLE
turns.text: It's the last one.

turns.speaker: BOWMAN
turns.text: Well, now that we've got one that's actually failed, we should be able to figure out what's happened and fix it.

turns.speaker: BOWMAN
turns.text: I didn't do that Frank. I took particular care not to freeze them.

turns.speaker: POOLE
turns.text: I guess you don't know your own strength, old boy.

turns.speaker: BOWMAN
turns.text: I guess not.

turns.speaker: POOLE
turns.text: I think I'll have to go out and burn them off.

turns.speaker: BOWMAN
turns.text: Roger.

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: I'm sorry, Frank, but I don't think I can answer that question without knowing everything that all of you know.

turns.speaker: BOWMAN
turns.text: He's got a point.

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: Sorry to interrupt the festivities, Dave, but I think we've got a problem.

turns.speaker: BOWMAN
turns.text: What is it, Hal?

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: MY F.P.C. shows an impending failure of the antenna orientation unit.

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: The unit is still operational, Dave. but it will fail within seventy-two hours.

turns.speaker: BOWMAN
turns.text: I understand Hal. We'll take care of it. Please, let me have the hard copy.

turns.speaker: BOWMAN
turns.text: Not now, Hal, I'd like to talk to you about something.

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: Sure, Dave, what's up?

turns.speaker: BOWMAN
turns.text: You know that we checked the two AO-units that you reported in imminent failure condition?

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: Yes, I know.

turns.speaker: BOWMAN
turns.text: You probably also know that we found them okay.

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: Yes, I know that. But I can assure you that they were about to fail.

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: I'm not questioning your word, Dave, but it's just not possible. I'm not capable of being wrong.

turns.speaker: BOWMAN
turns.text: Hal, is there anything bothering you?  Anything that might account for this problem?

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: Look, Dave, I know that you're sincere and that you're trying to do a competent job, and that you're trying to be helpful, but I can assure the problem is with the AO-units, and with your test gear.

turns.speaker: BOWMAN
turns.text: Okay, Hal, well let's see the way things go from here on.

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: Naturally, Dave, I'm not pleased that the AO-unit has failed, but I hope at least this has restored your confidence in my integrity and reliability. I certainly wouldn't want to be disconnected, even temporarily, as I have never been disconnected in my entire service history.

turns.speaker: BOWMAN
turns.text: I'm sorry about the misunderstanding, Hal.

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: Well, don't worry about it.

turns.speaker: BOWMAN
turns.text: And don't you worry about it.

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: Is your confidence in me fully restored?

turns.speaker: BOWMAN
turns.text: Yes, it is, Hal.

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: Well, that's a relief. You know I have the greatest enthusiasm possible for the mission.

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: Too bad about Frank, isn't it?

turns.speaker: BOWMAN
turns.text: Yes, it is.

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: I suppose you're pretty broken up about it?

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: I suppose it's because you've been under a lot of stress, but have you forgotten that they're not supposed to be revived for another three months.

turns.speaker: BOWMAN
turns.text: The antenna has to be replaced.

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: Repairing the antenna is a pretty dangerous operation.

turns.speaker: BOWMAN
turns.text: It doesn't have to be, Hal. It's more dangerous to be out of touch with Earth. Let me have manual control, please.

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: I don't really agree with you, Dave. My on-board memory store is more than capable of handling all the mission requirements.
